content.raw:
ya looks like sensors visualizations still works thanks to the `~/sensor` topic. The sensor msg received from `~/model/info` gets filtered out in `Scene::ProcessSensorMsg` because topic string is empty.

We should probably let users know about the missing fields in `~/model/info` since the topic is open to everyone
content.html:
ya looks like sensors visualizations still works thanks to the ~/sensor topic. The sensor msg received from ~/model/info gets filtered out in Scene::ProcessSensorMsg because topic string is empty.

We should probably let users know about the missing fields in ~/model/info since the topic is open to everyone

pull_request.title: Fix circular dependency between physics and sensors (issue #1516)

pullrequest.title: Fix circular dependency between physics and sensors (issue #1516)

content.raw:
I just glanced through our code real quick. `Sensor::FillMsg` gets called during `Sensor::Init` for publishing on `~/sensor` and it also gets called by `Link::FillMsg` which gets called by `World::LoadModel` for publishing on `~/model/info`. It is important because the `Scene` subscribes to both of these topics in order to create sensor visualizations (see [Scene::ProcessSensorMsg](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/9559e9655bdaadf4ebd627305713963f871bb0f8/gazebo/rendering/Scene.cc?fileviewer=file-view-default#Scene.cc-2202)). So I'm guessing that the sensor information in `~/model/info` will be incomplete, but sensor visualizations will still work because of the `~/sensor` topic message?

We should probably double-check that sensor visualizations are showing up.
content.html:
I just glanced through our code real quick. Sensor::FillMsg gets called during Sensor::Init for publishing on ~/sensor and it also gets called by Link::FillMsg which gets called by World::LoadModel for publishing on ~/model/info. It is important because the Scene subscribes to both of these topics in order to create sensor visualizations (see Scene::ProcessSensorMsg). So I'm guessing that the sensor information in ~/model/info will be incomplete, but sensor visualizations will still work because of the ~/sensor topic message?

We should probably double-check that sensor visualizations are showing up.

pull_request.title: Fix circular dependency between physics and sensors (issue #1516)

pullrequest.title: Fix circular dependency between physics and sensors (issue #1516)

content.raw:
There are some differences between `Sensor::FillMsg` and `msgs::SensorFromSDF`. 

- `msgs::SensorFromSDF` currently doesn't handle `wideanglecamera` and `logical_camera` sensors like in `Sensor::FillMsg`. `msgs::SensorFromSDF` only checks for 3 types of sensors - maybe that's sufficient?

- Sensor::FillMsg uses `GetTopic()` to fill the `topic` msg field and most sensors (e.g. CameraSensor, RaySensor) override this function with some custom string which are not written to SDF so it may not be the same as the string stored in `sensorElem`

- `msgs::SensorFromSDF` doesn't fill `id` and `parent_id` fields.

The tests are passing so maybe we're don't really use all the sensor fields anyways (or we don't have a test to catch this) but just want to note this down in case we need these fields in the future
content.html:
There are some differences between Sensor::FillMsg and msgs::SensorFromSDF.

  • msgs::SensorFromSDF currently doesn't handle wideanglecamera and logical_camera sensors like in Sensor::FillMsg. msgs::SensorFromSDF only checks for 3 types of sensors - maybe that's sufficient?

  • Sensor::FillMsg uses GetTopic() to fill the topic msg field and most sensors (e.g. CameraSensor, RaySensor) override this function with some custom string which are not written to SDF so it may not be the same as the string stored in sensorElem

  • msgs::SensorFromSDF doesn't fill id and parent_id fields.

The tests are passing so maybe we're don't really use all the sensor fields anyways (or we don't have a test to catch this) but just want to note this down in case we need these fields in the future

content.raw:
It does not fit well to get it into our logic of DSL job generation, since -any- jobs are generated for the default CI distro (Trusty in this case).

What it is really easy is to copy the trusty job and just change the distribution from the jenkins GUI. I've done that and schedule this branch:
http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/gazebo/job/gazebo-ci-pr_any-wily-amd64-gpu-none_temp/
content.html:
It does not fit well to get it into our logic of DSL job generation, since -any- jobs are generated for the default CI distro (Trusty in this case).

What it is really easy is to copy the trusty job and just change the distribution from the jenkins GUI. I've done that and schedule this branch: http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/gazebo/job/gazebo-ci-pr_any-wily-amd64-gpu-none_temp/
